{"id":300735013,"lang":"python3","time":"1 year, 5 months","timestamp":1580978230,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/300735013/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Trapping Rain Water","memory":"N/A","code":"\nclass Solution:\n    def trap(self, height):\n        ans, idx = 0, 0\n        # contain indices\n        st = []\n        while idx < len(height):\n            while st and height[idx] > height[st[-1]]:\n                top = st[-1]\n                st.pop()\n                if not st:\n                    break\n                dist = idx - st[-1] - 1\n                bounded_h = min(height[idx], height[st[-1]] - height[top])\n                ans += dist * bounded_h\n\n            st.append(idx)\n            idx += 1\n\n        return ans\n\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"trapping-rain-water"}
